content: May 4 (Reuters) - PBF Energy Inc said on Thursday Tom Nimbley will step down as chief executive officer after over a decade of leading the U.S. refiner.

Matthew Lucey, the company's current president, will succeed Nimbley, effective July 1.Nimbley has been the top boss since the refiner's initial public offering in 2012, after leading its private predecessor company as CEO since 2010.Nimbley will continue as executive chairman of the board, the company said.(Reporting by Ankit Kumar; Editing by Anil D'Silva and Shilpi Majumdar)
